title: How much oxygen is consumed while sleeping? - Quora

response.answer_text: Teenagers are supposed to need from 8-10 hours of sleep per night or a total of 8-10 hours per day. As regards your fatigue problem perhaps glandular fever or CFS are possibilities. One of the most common fatigue causes is anxiety, another disease that can cause this to happen is sickle cell anemia. A common cause of low oxygen at night can be diseases that agitate the lungs, causing inflammation, such as interstitial pneumonitis. Obesity and sleep apnea are other culprits when it comes to preventing efficient oxygen intake while you sleep.
